title: Progress Bar - Usage Examples
description: Visual progress indicators showing completion percentage with bars or circular pie charts

examples.name: Basic Skill Progress Bar
examples.description: Simple horizontal progress bar with icon and percentage
examples.visualDescription: Small height blue progress bar with WordPress icon, '85%' displayed on right, clean minimal design
examples.useCase: Skill showcases, portfolio pages, resume/CV sites, about pages

examples.name: Large Progress Bar with Subtitle and Gradient
examples.description: Full-height progress bar with separator (style-2) and gradient fill
examples.visualDescription: Thick progress bar with icon inside, title and subtitle stacked vertically, purple-to-pink gradient fill, triangular separator at progress end
examples.useCase: Professional portfolios, service showcases, team skill displays

examples.name: Circular Pie Chart Progress (75%)
examples.description: Circular progress indicator with gradient arc fill
examples.visualDescription: 200px circle with 8px thick arc, green gradient (27ae60 to 2ecc71), 75% filled clockwise, percentage displayed in center
examples.useCase: Project dashboards, completion trackers, goal progress, KPI displays

examples.name: Skills Comparison (Three Skill Bars)
examples.description: Multiple progress bars showcasing different skill levels
examples.visualDescription: Three stacked progress bars: React (90% blue), Node.js (75% green), MongoDB (65% leafgreen), each with matching icon and color scheme
examples.useCase: Developer portfolios, skill matrices, team capability displays, technology stacks

examples.name: Image Icon Progress Bar
examples.description: Progress bar using custom uploaded image instead of FontAwesome icon
examples.visualDescription: Progress bar with company logo or custom icon image (50px) on left, brand-colored fill, rounded image corners
examples.useCase: Brand metrics, company KPIs, custom achievement tracking, branded dashboards

examples.name: Progress Bar with Custom Symbol (No Percent)
examples.description: Progress bar using custom pre/post symbol instead of percentage
examples.visualDescription: Star rating progress bar showing '4.8/5.0' instead of percentage, gold star icon, warm gradient fill
examples.customNumberDisplay: Shows '4.8' as number (96% of 5.0) with '/5.0' suffix
examples.useCase: Ratings, reviews, satisfaction scores, quality metrics, performance grades

examples.name: Reverse Fill Pie Chart
examples.description: Circular progress with counter-clockwise fill direction
examples.visualDescription: Large 250px pie chart filling counter-clockwise (fillReverse:true), red-to-orange gradient, thick 12px arc, 60% completion
examples.useCase: Storage meters, capacity indicators, resource usage, quota displays

examples.name: Complete Progress Bar (All Features)
examples.description: Full-featured progress bar with all styling options enabled
examples.visualDescription: Large height bar (style-2) with WordPress icon inside, bold title 'Full Stack Development', subtitle list, 95% gradient fill (blue-purple), large styled percentage, custom spacing
examples.useCase: Premium portfolios, senior developer profiles, agency showcases, executive dashboards

validationRules.dynamicValue: Required for progressbar - string number 0-100 (e.g., '85' for 85%)
validationRules.dynamicPieValue: Required for piechart - string decimal 0-1 (e.g., '0.75' for 75%)
validationRules.dispNumber: Boolean - true shows percentage number, false hides it
validationRules.pieCircleSize: For piechart - string pixel value (e.g., '200' for 200px diameter)
validationRules.pieThickness: For piechart - string pixel value for arc thickness (e.g., '8' for 8px)
validationRules.pieColor2: For piechart gradient - second color (hex format)
validationRules.fillReverse: For piechart - boolean, true fills counter-clockwise
validationRules.Title: Progress bar title/label - recommended for context
validationRules.subTitle: Optional subtitle/description for additional context
validationRules.prepostSymbol: Symbol after (or before) number - '%' default, can use '/100', 'pts', etc.
validationRules.bgColor.openBg: Must be 1 to enable progress bar fill background
validationRules.emptyColor: Background color of unfilled portion (hex format)
validationRules.sepColor: For style-2 only - separator triangle color at progress end
validationRules.titleTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable title typography settings
validationRules.subTitleTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable subtitle typography settings
validationRules.numTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable number typography settings
validationRules.numPrePostTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable symbol typography settings

warnings: dynamicValue vs dynamicPieValue: Use dynamicValue (0-100) for progressbar, dynamicPieValue (0-1) for piechart - wrong value type breaks display
layoutType determines which attributes work: progressbar uses dynamicValue/styleType/heightType, piechart uses dynamicPieValue/pieCircleSize/pieThickness
bgColor.openBg must be 1 to see fill color - forgetting this makes progress invisible
bgColor.bgType='gradient' requires full bgGradient object with gradientType, gradientAngle, gradientColor array
pieColor2 is IGNORED unless pieFillColor='gradient' - set pieFillColor first
heightType only applies to layoutType='progressbar' - ignored for piechart
styleType only applies to layoutType='progressbar' - style-2 adds separator triangle at progress end
sepColor only works with styleType='style-2' - ignored for style-1
iconType determines which icon attributes are used: 'iconIcon' uses IconName, 'iconImage' uses imageName.url
When iconType='iconImage', imageName.url is REQUIRED - empty URL shows broken image
pieCircleSize, pieThickness, pieFillColor, pieColor1/2, fillReverse only work with layoutType='piechart'
dynamicValue must be STRING '0'-'100', not number 0-100 (e.g., '85' not 85)
dynamicPieValue must be STRING '0.0'-'1.0', not number (e.g., '0.75' not 0.75)
openTypography:1 required before setting titleTypo/subTitleTypo/numTypo/numPrePostTypo - otherwise typography ignored
Large height bars (heightType='large-height') display icon, title, and subtitle inside the bar - ensure sufficient contrast with bgColor
For accessibility, ensure numberColor and titleColor have 4.5:1 contrast ratio with background
commonMistakes: Using dynamicValue for piechart or dynamicPieValue for progressbar - layouts require different value types
Forgetting openBg:1 in bgColor - progress bar fill invisible without it
Setting pieCircleSize/pieThickness on progressbar layout - these only work for piechart
Not enabling gradient: setting pieColor2 without pieFillColor='gradient' - second color ignored
Using number instead of string for dynamicValue ('85' not 85) - breaks progress calculation
Setting openTypography:0 but trying to configure fontSize/fontWeight - typography won't apply
Forgetting imageName.url when iconType='iconImage' - shows broken image placeholder
Using style-2 separator without setting sepColor - separator invisible or default color
Setting fillReverse on progressbar - only works for piechart
Not providing Title - progress bar lacks context, confusing for users
Using emptyColor too close to bgColor - progress difficult to see
Setting large iconSize on small-height bar - icon gets cut off
Copying bgGradient from other blocks without adjusting to bgColor format - gradient won't render
Using subTitle without subTitleTypo - subtitle displays but without custom styling
Forgetting to set dispNumber:true - percentage hidden when you want it visible
bestPractices: **Value Ranges:** Use 60-95% for skills to appear expert without seeming boastful; 96%+ seems unrealistic
**Color Psychology:** Use green (success, growth), blue (trust, stability), orange (creativity), red (urgency, alerts)
**Gradient Direction:** Horizontal gradients (90deg) work best for progressbar, subtle gradients for professional look
**Icon Consistency:** Use same icon library (FontAwesome) across all progress bars for visual harmony
**Typography Scale:** Title 16-18px, subtitle 12-14px, number 18-28px for balanced hierarchy
**Empty Color:** Use light neutral gray (#e0e0e0, #ecf0f1, #f8f8f8) for unfilled portion to avoid distraction
**Symbol Choice:** Use '%' for percentages, '/5.0' for ratings, 'pts' for points, '/100' for scores
**Spacing:** Add pbTopMargin (15-20px) to separate title from progress bar for breathing room
**Contrast:** Ensure text inside large-height bars contrasts with bgColor (white text on dark backgrounds)
**Number Placement:** Always display number (dispNumber:true) for clarity - progress bars without numbers lack context
**Pie Chart Size:** 200-250px diameter works well for desktop, smaller for mobile (responsive)
**Arc Thickness:** 5-8px for subtle pies, 10-15px for bold statement pies
**Grouping:** When showing multiple skills, sort by proficiency (highest to lowest) for better UX
**Layout Choice:** Use progressbar for multiple skills comparison, piechart for single completion metrics
**Style Selection:** style-1 for minimal designs, style-2 for modern/premium look with separator accent
**Height Selection:** small-height for compact skill lists (4-8 bars), large-height for featured/hero sections (1-3 bars)
**Accessibility:** Add meaningful Title for screen readers, ensure color contrast meets WCAG AA
**Animation:** Progress bars animate on scroll by default - place where users can see the fill animation
**Responsive Design:** Test on mobile - large pie charts may need smaller pieCircleSize on xs breakpoints

progressbar.description: Horizontal bar that fills from left to right showing completion
progressbar.bestFor: Multiple skills comparison, stat displays, feature lists, progress tracking
progressbar.visualCharacteristics: Linear, easy to compare multiple bars, space-efficient vertically
progressbar.useCases: Developer skills (React 90%, Node 75%), product features, service ratings

piechart.description: Circular arc that fills clockwise (or counter-clockwise) showing completion
piechart.bestFor: Single metric focus, completion status, goal progress, visual impact
piechart.visualCharacteristics: Circular, attention-grabbing, takes more space, single focus
piechart.useCases: Project completion (75%), storage usage (60%), goal achievement, KPIs

style-1.description: Basic horizontal progress bar with rounded edges, no separator
style-1.bestFor: Clean minimal designs, multiple skill bars, compact layouts

style-2.description: Progress bar with triangular separator accent at progress end
style-2.bestFor: Modern premium designs, featured progress bars, hero sections
style-2.requires: sepColor attribute for separator triangle color

pieStyle-1.description: Circular arc progress with percentage displayed in center
pieStyle-1.bestFor: Dashboard widgets, completion indicators, goal trackers

small-height.description: Compact progress bar with icon and title above bar, number on right side
small-height.bestFor: Multiple skill lists (4-8 bars), sidebar widgets, compact displays
small-height.layoutPattern: Icon + Title (above bar) → Progress Bar → Number (right side)

large-height.description: Tall progress bar with icon, title, and subtitle inside the filled area
large-height.bestFor: Hero sections, featured stats (1-3 bars), prominent displays
large-height.layoutPattern: Icon + Title + Subtitle (inside bar) → Number (right side)
large-height.important: Requires high contrast between text color and bgColor for readability

responsivePatterns.description: Smaller pie charts on mobile to fit screen width
responsivePatterns.implementation: Use responsive values in pieCircleSize attribute (currently not shown in examples, but supported)

responsivePatterns.description: Vertical stack of progress bars for skill comparison
responsivePatterns.setup: Place multiple progress bar blocks in single tp-column, add consistent spacing

responsivePatterns.description: 2-3 pie charts in row using tp-row + tp-column for dashboard
responsivePatterns.setup: Use tp-row with 2-3 tp-column children, one piechart per column

accessibilityNotes: **Meaningful Titles:** Always provide Title attribute - screen readers announce 'WordPress 85%' not just '85%'
**Color Contrast:** Ensure numberColor and titleColor have 4.5:1 ratio with background for WCAG AA
**Large-Height Contrast:** White text (#ffffff) on dark bgColor or dark text on light bgColor for in-bar text
**Symbol Context:** Use standard symbols (%) or clear alternatives (/5.0, pts) so screen readers announce correctly
**Number Display:** Always enable dispNumber:true - visual-only progress bars exclude screen reader users
**Semantic Markup:** Progress bars use semantic HTML <progress> element for accessibility
**Keyboard Navigation:** Progress bars are not interactive, no keyboard focus needed
**ARIA Labels:** Plugin automatically adds aria-label with title and percentage for screen readers
**Color Independence:** Don't rely solely on color to convey meaning - include number and title
**Animation:** Progress fill animates on scroll - ensure animation can be disabled for vestibular disorders (browser settings)
performanceConsiderations: **Animation Performance:** Progress fill animations use CSS transforms - hardware accelerated, performant
**Pie Chart SVG:** Pie charts render as SVG - lightweight and scalable at any size
**Icon Loading:** FontAwesome icons load from global library - ensure FA loaded once in header
**Image Icons:** If using iconType='iconImage', optimize images (compress, use SVG) for faster load
**Gradient Rendering:** CSS gradients are performant - no image assets needed
**Multiple Bars:** Limit to 8-10 progress bars per page section to avoid DOM bloat
**Lazy Loading:** Consider lazy loading progress bars below the fold to prioritize above-fold content
**Responsive Images:** Use responsive imageSize values (thumbnail for mobile, medium for desktop) to avoid oversized downloads
**Color Values:** Use hex (#667eea) or rgba format - avoid named colors for better browser compatibility
**Minimal Typography:** Don't enable openTypography:1 unless customizing - reduces CSS specificity overhead
integrationPatterns: **About Page Skills:** Place 4-6 small-height progress bars in tp-column for skill showcase
**Team Member Profiles:** Combine with tp-team-member-list, add 2-3 progress bars per member for expertise
**Service Pages:** Use large-height bars with gradient fills to highlight service quality metrics
**Portfolio Hero:** Feature 1-2 large pie charts showing project completion or client satisfaction
**Sidebar Widgets:** Stack 3-4 small-height bars in sidebar to show blog stats or achievements
**Pricing Tables:** Add progress bars to tp-pricing-table to show feature completeness per plan
**Dashboard Pages:** Grid of 3-4 pie charts using tp-row + tp-column for KPI overview
**Resume/CV Sites:** Multiple skill bars grouped by category (Languages, Frameworks, Tools)
**Product Pages:** Show product ratings or feature completeness with styled progress bars
**Testimonial Sections:** Add star-based progress bars (/5.0 symbol) near tp-testimonials for rating context

commonPatterns.description: 4-6 stacked small-height bars showing programming language proficiency
commonPatterns.setup: Use language-specific FA icons (fab fa-js, fab fa-python, fab fa-react) with matching brand colors

commonPatterns.description: Grid of 3 pie charts showing different project phases
commonPatterns.setup: Place in tp-row with 3 tp-columns, one piechart per column, use green (complete), blue (in-progress), gray (pending)

commonPatterns.description: 2-3 large-height bars with gradient fills for premium service display
commonPatterns.setup: Use high values (90%+), bold titles, premium gradients (purple-pink, blue-teal)

commonPatterns.description: Single progress bar showing rating out of 5 with star icon
Pie chart with reverse fill showing resource usage
commonPatterns.setup: Use warm colors (red-orange) for high usage warning, add subtitle with actual values

commonPatterns.description: Grouped progress bars by skill category (Frontend, Backend, Tools)
commonPatterns.setup: Use tp-heading between groups, 3-4 bars per group, consistent color per category

commonPatterns.description: Each team member photo with 2-3 skill bars showing specialties
commonPatterns.setup: Integrate with tp-team-member-list, small custom image icons, compact small-height bars

commonPatterns.description: Clean monochrome progress bars for professional sites
commonPatterns.setup: Use single brand color for all bars, no icons, simple sans-serif typography
